text: English grammar lesson 11 it's time now
to talk about a special group of verbs
modal verbs and modal like expressions
these are verbs like must should could
modal like expressions are verbs like
have to be supposed to let's talk about
which of these modal verbs change and if
they change how do they change in this
lesson we'll answer these questions
which modal verbs don't change which
modal verbs and modal like expressions
do change how do they change
might and should are to modal verbs that
don't change example Jim said he might
buy his wife a car for her birthday the
original words were I might buy my wife
a car for her birthday next example I
told Jim he should buy a less expensive
gift the original words were you should
buy a less expensive gift ought to and
would also don't change in reported
speech example Ryan told Jim he ought to
take his wife on a trip instead the
original words you ought to take your
wife on a trip instead next example
Jim's wife said she would like to go to
a nice restaurant for dinner the
original words I would like to go to a
nice restaurant for dinner
could is another modal verb that does
not change in reported speech example
she also told Jim that he could surprise
her with tickets to a concert or theater
performance the original words you could
surprise me with tickets to a concert or
theater performance had better is the
final modal verb that does not change in
reported speech example I told Jim that
he had better decide soon because his
wife's birthday was one week away the
original words you'd better decide soon
because your wife's birthday is one week
away in reported speech we do not change
perfect modal's meaning modal verbs in
their past forms example quoted speech
Jack must have saved a lot of money
I said reported speech I said that Jack
must have saved a lot of money the form
stays the same the same rule applies to
the progressive form for example I said
that Jack must have been saving money
for quite some time
the original verb phrase
have been saving does not change now
let's talk about modal verbs that do
change can shifts back to could example
quoted speech Erin said I can help you
choose a gift for Rob reported speech
Erin said she could help me choose a
gift for Rob may can shift back to could
or might depending on how it's being
used example you may not go to the party
my mother said there may be drinking
there and you are too young for alcohol
my mother told me that I couldn't go to
the party she said there might be
drinking there and I was too young for
alcohol in the first sentence may not
shifts back to couldn't this is
permission the mother is not giving
permission so may changes to could it's
in the negative so may not be comes
couldn't in the second sentence may
express as a possibility in this case
may can shift back to might or could
must shifts back to had to example
quoted speech I must find a gift for Rob
soon I told Erin reported speech I told
Erin that I had to find a gift for Rob
soon modal like expressions usually
shift back to their past forms in
reported speech for example have to or
has to changes too had to example quoted
speech I have to buy wrapping paper and
a birthday card I told Erin reported
speech
I told Erin that I had to buy wrapping
paper and a birthday card be supposed to
shifts back to was ur were supposed to
example quoted speech Rob isn't supposed
to know about the party I said I told
Erin that Rob wasn't supposed to know
about
the party let's try our first exercise
[Music]
the following video was made one week
ago listen to Jennifer speak today is my
friend's birthday so I must think of a
way to wish her a happy birthday I might
buy her a cake
what did Jennifer say Jennifer said that
it was her friend's birthday that day
she had to think of a way to wish her
friend a happy birthday
then Jennifer said that she might buy a
cake so what did I do
I decided to go to a bakery and buy a
cake de Fusco and son Italian bakery is
a North Andover Massachusetts while I
was buying a cake I talked to some of
the people who work in the bakery listen
then report each statement make all
necessary changes to the verbs example
listen to Al the owner and head Baker I
asked him if he's happy to be a baker
I can't think of any other job I'd
rather go What did he say take a look at
his words and think how you would change
them do both modal verbs change answer
al a baker said that he couldn't think
of any other job he'd rather do
one listen to Alisha an assistant at the
bakery
I asked what kinds of cakes they make we
play yellow chocolate marble cake what
did she say
here are her words how would you report
them Alicia said that they could make
white yellow chocolate and marble cakes
number two listen again to Alicia I
asked her about special order cakes
cakes with a special design
you may choose a design from this
catalog where you can tell us what you
like and we can make it what did she say
here are her words how would you report
them let's take this slowly Alicia said
you could choose a design from that
catalog or you could tell them what you
would like and they could make it
listen now to Al I asked how far in
advance
someone had to order a cake customer she
thought a cake 2 to 3 days in advance
What did he say here are his words how
would you report them
al said that customers should order
special cakes 2 to 3 days in advance
for listen to Jennifer you're going to
report my words in the third person I
have to find room in the refrigerator
for this cake what did she say
here are my words remember you need to
report my words in the third person
Jennifer said that she had to find room
in the refrigerator for that cake
[Music]
there's more to come
in following lessons we'll practice
reporting conditionals reporting
questions reporting commands and using
other reporting verbs additional
practice is available at English cafe
comm my user name is Jennifer ESL the
follow-up exercise to this lesson is now
available the direct link is listed in
the video description that's all for now
thanks for watching and happy studies
[Music]
